page.title: 07Brundon Farm
page.content: The owner of Brundon Farm is Mr P Norman.He has 437 acres of land some of which is used for animal grazing and the other for wheat,barley and sugarbeet crops.Mr Norman has 1 combine harvester,2 tractors,3 ploughs,2 trailers,1 baler and 3 crop sprayers. He has 56 fresian cows which he looks after for other farmers and also some other animals like horses and chickens. Mr Norman employs 2 men but his father employed 12 in 1943. Some of the cottages around the farm date back to the first Domesday Book. In 1943 you could get 1 ton of corn per acre and in 1985 you could get 2-3 tonnes an acre. Mr Norman is Chairman of the Governors of Uplands Middle School and spoke to us in class and at his farm. Daemmon Reeve,Alex Wilson,Gavin Taylor, Martin Iddiols,Stephen Bloomfield.
